attributes.action: Restore the the vital consumer protection afforded by the 28-day cancellation rule in gas and electricity contracts
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ofgem, the regulator of the energy suppliers, has ended the right of the 45 million UK energy consumers to back out of their contracts with suppliers with just four week's notice. 

In July 2003 Ofgem submitted a paper to the Energy Services Working Group in which it claimed that this rule gave consumers "vital" protection and did not stop energy suppliers from "bundling energy efficiency measures with energy supplies". 

Last week Ofgem claimed precisely the opposite as it cancelled our most important protection. 

The regulator's prime responsibility is to foster competition and thereby protect the interest of consmers - it appears to have abandoned its central role and betrayed our interests. 

This cannnot stand.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Restore the the vital consumer protection afforded by the 28-day cancellation rule in gas and electricity contracts."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
